body.description: This pre-owned or refurbished product has been professionally inspected and tested to work and look like new. How a product becomes part of Amazon Renewed, your destination for pre-owned, refurbished products: A customer buys a new product and returns it or trades it in for a newer or different model. That product is inspected and tested to work and look like new by Amazon-qualified suppliers. Then, the product is sold as an Amazon Renewed product on Amazon. If not satisfied with the purchase, renewed products are eligible for replacement or refund under the Amazon Renewed Guarantee.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A specialty mouse that actual feels good!
reviews.reviewText: I've tried many differnet 'ergonomic' mice over the years and have never felt comfortable with any of them. This vertical concept by Anker changes the game. I was hesitant to purchase due to all the failures in the past, but reviews were basically good and the price was great. I didn't expect much, so much to my surprise it was a go from out of the box! To hold the mouse this way is revolutionary. Such a simple design, whover came up with this was a genius. It's basically a standard mouse turned on it's side. No crazy rolling track balls or funky bumps or twists. Some of the ergonomic choices out there look like they were inspired by the look of an armadillo. This sleek and modern design is so easy to hold and use, you will be questioning why the original mouse wasn't designed this way. I have early stages of arthritis so this purchase is really a game changer for me. I would recommned this mouse to anyone who uses a mouse regulary and suffers from hand, wrist and finger pain. Kudos to Anker, well designed and slick looking. Doesn't look like an $18 mouse, I will tell you that for sure. I would have paid $49-$69 for it and felt like it was a fair price.Don't hesitate to give it a try if your hands are tired of the standard mouse design. I've purchased other products by Anker and for the price, they have all been well made with sleek, upscale design.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Not for small hands
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Good quality, easy to follow instructions, comfortable, however I have smaller hands than most females and I feel this mouse was too big for someone with small hands. Takes two AAA batteries and plugs into a USB port.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars No pain mouse!
reviews.reviewText: I struggle with joint pain and, due to my job and an antiquated pc system, it can hurt but this mouse is wonderful and ergonomic… no more pain and I can click, click away.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A Decent Office Mouse
reviews.reviewText: I got this mouse because I wanted to try an ergonomic office mouse to relieve pressure on my wrists, and I will say that it has decreased the fatigue of long usage sessions. Overall, a decent mouse for the money, but not perfect either. It is pretty ligthweight, so it is easy to move around, but beware that the sharp edges on the glide pads at the bottom of the mouse dig into a fabric surface like a mousepad, decreasing the speed of movement, as well as increasing wear on the mousepad. It is comfortable in the hand, and all buttons are accessible, but rarely in the way, preempting misinputs. The fact that it is wireless is a huge plus, although I will say that being wireless, this mouse suffers in responsiveness, especially at high mouse sensitivity settings. That will make fine movements, like highlighting text, a challenge as it will jump from one spot to another. This can be very frustrating for office work. The DPI's are more or less in the advertised range. After rigorous and meticulous testing, I have found the mouse to be capable of ~750, ~1240, and ~1500 DPI on the respective settings. If you are okay with having a wired mouse and need high sensitivity I would strongly recommend getting the wired version of this mouse instead, the AK-98ANWVM-BA. But if you require a wireless setup and prefer lower mouse sensitivity, this mouse will be more than adequate. Just make sure not to use the highest DPI setting, as that will increase sensitivity by a huge margin. Overall, Anker has once again made an affordable, yet adequate product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice for a more comfortable wrist position
reviews.reviewText: I found this mouse to be very comfortable and easy to use for long hours at the computer. I'm 6'3 and have pretty big hands, and it was a nice size and weight, especially with the batteries in place to make it feel a little heavier. The button clicks are nice and snappy, and it seems like a great mouse for the price.The only frustration that I ran into is that since I primarily use 3D modeling apps, I have to click and hold the middle mouse button a lot for viewport navigation, but the middle button placed just a tiny bit too low and I have to skew my index finger trying to reach it until it became pretty uncomfortable. But that's a very specific use, and I'd definitely still give this mouse 5 stars as a great performer for normal use, and even for using the middle button as a typical scroll wheel.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I like this product while it lasted. It was comfortable on my wrist and worked well. I am disappointed that it only lasted for four months. I tried everything, change the batteries remove the device, checked the driver status, but one day it just stopped working all together after about four months of use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars You don't have to go with expensive.
reviews.reviewText: This mouse has put my carpel tunnel into remission. I spend hours editing. A friend recommended a bar mouse, but the price was way out of my budget. So I decided to try this design. I'm on mouse number 3 from Anker in 5 years. I'm sure they would last longer if I didn't constantly knock them off my desk. Considering the abuse, I've found the Anker ergonomic mouse is a real workhorse.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good while it lasted
reviews.reviewText: Purchased this refurbished in September 2022. It’s now November 2023. The scroll on the mouse is pointless at this point, and has been for the past few months. Whenever I scroll, it does the opposite on the screen and bounces around and is unreliable to actually scroll in the direction you’re intending, and you find that your better off moving your mouse to the scroll bar or arrows to move up/down a page. So now I’m in the market for another mouse after only a year.That said, the ergonomics of the mouse are wonderful. Very easy to get acclimated to and it definitely made the soreness I had been experiencing in my wrist disappear for the most part. So this issue with the scroll really has me disappointed.

Da meine Arbeit nur am PC stattfindet und ich seit längerem etwas Probleme mit meinem Handgelenk hatte, habe ich mir diese Maus gekauft, denn Vorsicht ist besser als Nachsicht. Zwar kann ich in der kurzen Zeit (ca. 1 Woche) noch viel berichten, dennoch habe ich festgestellt, dass meine Hand sich am Abend leichter bewegen lässt. Ich jedenfalls bin zufrieden damit.
Fühlt sich richtig gut in der Hand an, auch nach lange mb Tagen vorm PC!
